act.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: The new president’s first act should be to end the war.
The act of writing a list can help to calm you down.
Lindsay paused in the act of putting down the phone.
in the act of doing something
act.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: a law that has been officially accepted by Parliament or Congress
act.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: the Housing and Community Development Act of 1977
act.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: insincere behaviour in which you pretend to have a particular kind of feeling or to be a particular kind of person
act.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: Mike played the loving husband in front of the children but it was all an act.
Be natural. Don’t feel you have to put on an act.
act.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: one of the main parts into which a stage play, opera etc is divided
act.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: I arrived at the theatre late and missed the first act.
act.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: a short performance on stage or television by someone who plays music or tells jokes
act.translation[0].definitions[4].exampl: The argument was just part of their act.
act.translation[0].definitions[5].defini: a performer or a group of performers who perform together
act.translation[0].definitions[5].exampl: The band is one of many acts that have been booked for the concert.
act.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 1: one thing that you do
act.translation[0].note_box[0].sections[: an act of violence/aggression
Incidents of sexual harassment and acts of violence against women were on the increase.
an act of kindness/love
We were grateful for her act of kindness.
an act of faith
The signing of the treaty with Britain was an act of faith.
an act of terrorism
It was the worst act of terrorism in US history.
an act of vandalism
These mindless acts of vandalism affect the whole community.
an act of defiance
As an act of defiance Leigh dropped out of high school a month before graduation.
an act of courage/bravery
The men were awarded the medals for acts of courage.
a criminal/illegal/unlawful  act
Starting the fire was a highly irresponsible criminal act.
a violent/aggressive act
We will track down those responsible for this violent act.
terrorist acts
terrorists acts like the Oklahoma City bombing
a cowardly act
The United States strongly condemns this cowardly act by murderous extremists.
a heroic act
Ordinary people sometimes find themselves performing heroic acts.
a deliberate/conscious act
Clearly this was a deliberate act of vandalism.
a symbolic act
The Tibetan climber will pass the Olympic flame to his Chinese partner in a symbolic act of friendship.
commit an act
Anyone committing an illegal act deserves to be punished.
perform an act
The nurses performed many small acts of kindness.
act.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 2: a law that has been officially accepted by Parliament or Congress
act.translation[0].note_box[1].sections[: Once Parliament has passed an act, it becomes the law of the land.
In 1961, before the Divorce Law Reform Act was introduced, the divorce rate was only 2.1%.
In 1978 the act was amended to make the earliest mandatory retirement age 70.
The Act was repealed by the incoming Labour government.
In the 40 years since the Abortion Act became law there have been repeated attempts to amend or repeal it.
Since the act came into force, all public buildings must have disabled access.
Section 47 of the Act prohibits the making of misleading statements to the police.
act.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: to do something in a particular way or for a particular reason
act.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: The company acted correctly in sacking him.
The jury decided that Walker had acted in self-defence.
Politicians will only act when enough people demand that they do something.
The UN must act now to restore democracy.
act.translation[1].definitions[0].note_b: In everyday English, people often use expressions like do the right thing or do a brave thing rather than use act with an adverb such as correctly or bravely:
We have to do something now.
When act is used alone to mean ‘take action’, in everyday English people usually just say do something:
We have to do something now.
act.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: to behave in a particular way
act.translation[1].definitions[1].note.t: act your age (=used to tell someone to behave in a more adult way, suitable for someone of their age)
act.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: They acted unreasonably when they turned down Jill’s application.
He’s been acting strangely ever since his mom died.
Pip acted as if he was better than everyone else.
act.translation[1].definitions[2].defini: to pretend to have feelings, qualities etc that are different from your true ones
act.translation[1].definitions[2].exampl: When he’s angry, he acts the fool.
Stella felt unnatural in their company, as if she was acting a part.
Why does he act as if he was stupid?
act.translation[1].definitions[3].defini: to perform in a play or film
act.translation[1].definitions[3].exampl: I first started acting when I was 12 years old.
The movie is very well acted.
She is acting the role of Lady Macbeth six evenings a week.
act.translation[1].definitions[4].defini: to have an effect or use
act.translation[1].definitions[4].exampl: The padding acts as a cushion if the player falls or is hit by the ball.
Disinfectants act on bacteria in two main ways.
act.translation[3].definitions[0].defini: a law that has been officially accepted by the governing body of a country
act.translation[3].definitions[0].exampl: an act to regulate the carrying on of investment business
act.translation[3].definitions[1].defini: a written agreement that has legal force
act.translation[4].definitions[0].defini: to do a particular job or have a particular role
act.translation[4].definitions[0].exampl: We will act as the company’s agent for the sale.
Mortgage brokers act as middlemen between borrowers and lenders.
act.translation[4].definitions[1].defini: if a lawyer acts for someone, he or she represents them in a legal case
act.translation[4].definitions[1].exampl: the lawyer acting for the insurance company
act.translation[4].definitions[2].exampl: The two parties may agree a price for the land or ask an agent to act on their behalf.
act.translation[4].definitions[3].defini: to take action as a result of something that has been said, written, suggested etc
act.translation[4].definitions[3].exampl: Congress is eager to act on the report.
The administration hasn’t yet acted on the request.
